item.title: C++ execution model and memory order
item.description: Execution Model Abstract Machine C++ programs describe operations that are performed on the abstract machine. C++ implementations define the characteristics of the abstract machine and translate operations on the abstract machine into operations on the system. Storage Model Storage is flat; no notion hierarchy (caches, etc). Objects reside in storage at a single memory location. Some objects may not have a unique memory location: Eligible empty base classes Objects marked
